title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: An exclusive report in the Weekend Australian reveals former opposition leader Bill Shorten asked the Labor Party to help him soften his image but was rejected in one of a number of disagreements mentioned in a review into the party's election loss. The review found the party had a confusing campaign message with too many policies, not enough policy defence and Mr Shorten was deeply unpopular. The ALP received a primary vote of 33.3 per cent nationally and performed particularly poorly in Queensland and Western Australia. Image: News Corp Australia
